[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Do your sons like ice skating as well?
The older one seems to like it while the youngest cannot be bothered. Are you going to visit your sons in Europe soon?
Yes!  As a matter of fact, I'm visiting my son that lives in Spain next month.  This will give me a chance to finally meet his girlfriend of three years now!
Oh nice. You must be looking forward to it. He must have told you a lot about her. Do you think you would like her?

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Children Studying Abroad', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A shares about his sons studying in Spain and going to Italy next.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker B: Ah, that's great. Only one of my sons loves Chinese food as much as I do. The other really just likes Italian food, so it can be difficult to decide where to go. ### Speaker A: It sounds like an international fight!!  My sons just got back from studying abroad. They are leaving again in a few months.  ### Speaker B: It's nice that you got to spend some time with them. I'd be so worried if my boys traveled so far away. Luckily it will be a long time before they're old enough. ### Speaker A: It's stressful and I worry all the time, but I am happy for them. Enjoying them while you can. They grow up fast.  ### Speaker B: Oh yeah, definitely. Where have your boys been studying? ### Speaker A: They have been in Spain and they are going to Italy next. The European tour!!' }(2) {'Related Topics': 'Sons' Relationships', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B talk about their sons' relationships.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: That's very cool! Do any of your sons have any girlfriends? ### Speaker B: Well one of my son has a girlfriend for like several years, and for my other younger son I honestly have no idea. My younger son is just being so secretive, he won't even let me go into his room! ### Speaker A: My sons had that period also when they wouldn't go out of their room and play video games and listen to music. One of my sons has a girlfriend though ### Speaker B: Haha maybe our sons will mash well. Honestly I think my younger son might be secretly gay but doesn't want to come out yet for whatever reason. ' }
```
